thing.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an idea, action, feeling, or fact that someone thinks, does, says, or talks about, or that happens
thing.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: People say things they don’t mean when they are angry.
It was a horrible thing to happen.
I plan to do all the things I’ve been meaning to do for ages.
The first thing to do is to give them food and shelter.
That’s a terrible thing to say.
Getting more American ideas into British business would be a good thing.
‘I did no such thing, ’ he protested.
I know a thing or two (=a lot) about dogs.
In a democracy, it is no bad thing to be able to compromise  (=it is good, even though it may not seem good).
I kept wondering if I was doing the right thing.
A priest has to arrange funerals, marriages, that sort of thing.
thing.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an object that you are talking about without saying its name, or whose name you do not know
thing.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’ll just switch this thing off.
There was a round metal thing on the path.
The shed is where we keep our tools and things.
thing.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used as part of a negative statement to mean ‘anything’
thing.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There’s no such thing as ghosts  (=they do not exist).
I couldn’t find a thing that I wanted to buy.
He took his glasses off and couldn’t see a thing.
thing.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used to talk to or about a person or animal, when you are describing what they are like or showing sympathy for them
thing.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The baby is a nice little thing when he’s not screaming.
She was terribly upset, poor thing.
thing.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: used to say something about a particular part of a situation, person etc
thing.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: It’s a good thing  you saw her before she saw you.
The funny thing is, I really enjoyed it, even though I hadn’t expected to.
The thing about teaching is that it takes more time to prepare than most people realize.
thing.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3:
thing.translation[0].note_box[0].section: If things went well, we would double our money in five years.
Things have changed dramatically over the last few years.
As the recession proceeds, things will get worse.
Measures to slow down traffic on the main street have actually made things worse.
As things stand at the moment, I have no intention of becoming a candidate myself.
Obviously, there had to be some mistake. As things turned out, there was.
I’m not at all dissatisfied with the way things are at the moment.
thing.translation[0].note_box[1].section: thing
used when you do not need to say the name, or when you do not know the name
What’s that thing on the kitchen table?
Have you got all your things?
something
a thing – used when you are not sure what the thing is
There’s something on your shirt.
a solid thing
a sharp metal object
item
a particular kind of thing, or one of a group of things
household items
a luxury item
an item of equipment
The items included pieces of old pottery.
You are not allowed to take sharp items onto the plane.
article
a particular kind of thing, or one of a group of things. Article is very formal, and is used especially in the phrase an article of clothing
They found several articles of clothing in the bushes.
suspicious articles
Each article has a card with it giving more information.
artifact
an object that someone has made, especially one that is very old and has historical value
The museum has a collection of early Roman artifacts.
thingy
a thing – used especially when you cannot remember the name of the thing, but often the other person knows what you are talking about
Can you pass me the thingy?
